title: 10 Brilliant Examples of How to Open Your Blog Post With a Bang
text: The most important sentence in any article is the first one. If it doesn’t induce the reader to proceed to the second sentence, your article is dead. And if the second sentence doesn’t induce him to continue to the third sentence, it’s equally dead. Of such a progression of sentences, each tugging the reader forward until … safely hooked, a writer constructs that fateful unit: the lead

title: I quit the news. Consider it too.
text: This is my estimate on how much time I spent in the last 12 months following the US election. Reading articles, watching Youtube videos, participating in discussions on Facebook, watching all the US late night comedians and their spin on the Trump phenomenon.

title: The iPhone Is Bigger Than Donald Trump
text: Last night, our optimism was shaken. We know that the other America has legitimate issues, but him? After our initial expressions of disbelief and grief, we began to contemplate whether we should publish our scheduled story for today. “The piece I’d prepared doesn’t seem appropriate at this moment,” one editor Slacked, and indeed how could any piece? I’m betting that all of our team felt like I did, reading posts from Facebook friends weighing which countries might provide asylum, or reading the doom-soaked takes from the Times and The New Yorker. And we’re going to act like the world is still on its axis, and do one more story about technology?
